definition: once/already/ever (in the past)/former/previously/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)

sentences.english: So his not-so-great grandson could get in?
sentences.chinese: 所以他的不肖的曾孫子就可以進去？

sentences.english: They’ll love it, and some day so will their great-grandchildren.
sentences.chinese: 將來的某一天，他們的曾孫也會愛上它。

sentences.english: I believe that his great grandchildren will benefit as well.
sentences.chinese: 我相信，他的曾孫也將受益。

sentences.english: Zenani was one of Mr Mandela's nine great-grandchildren.
sentences.chinese: 澤娜尼是曼德拉九個曾孫輩後代中的一個。

sentences.english: One year he came with a great-grandchild.
sentences.chinese: 有一年，他帶着一個曾孫來。

sentences.english: Four generations were represented, from my grandmother on down to her great-grandson.
sentences.chinese: 我們四代同堂，從祖母那代開始，到她的曾孫。

sentences.english: Through the conversation with this gentleman, I learned that he is Mr.
sentences.chinese: 談話中，得知這位正是朱啓鈐先生的曾孫朱延琦先生。

sentences.english: Was the great-granddaughter of Mr. Clean.
Nelson Mandela, the former president, didn't attend because his great-granddaughter was killed in a car crash.
sentences.chinese: 南非前總統曼德拉因曾孫女遇車禍身亡缺席。

definition: Zhangzi county in Shanxi 山西[Shan1 xi1]
to bestow a surname (of emperor conferring favor on ethnic group)
to avoid mentioning/taboo word/name of deceased emperor or superior
Zanhuang county in Shijiazhuang 石家莊|石家庄[Shi2 jia1 zhuang1], Hebei
Lu, vassal state at the time of the Zhou Dynasty 周朝|周朝[Zhou1 chao2], located in the southwest of present-day Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1], birthplace of Confucius
Wujin district of Changzhou city 常州市[Chang2 zhou1 shi4], Jiangsu
